summary: This document is an email chain from April 29-30, 2020, discussing a victim's eligibility for the Office for Victims of Services (OVS) compensation related to Jeffrey Epstein's crimes. The emails involve attorneys discussing whether a victim abused in Florida can qualify under a New York indictment, and include a forwarded message from Brittany Henderson attaching an OVS application.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Appears as the sender of a forwarded email attaching an OVS application for a victim and coordinating with other attorneys.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) in Brittany Henderson's email regarding the OVS application for a victim.

persons.name: Randee Kogan
persons.context: Mentioned as the intended treatment provider for the victim if the OVS application is approved.

connections.description: Colleagues or legal professionals coordinating on a victim's OVS application, as Edwards is copied on Henderson's email.
Henderson references Kogan as the treatment provider for the victim if the OVS application is approved.

events.title: OVS Application Discussion
events.description: Email exchange among attorneys discussing a victim's eligibility for OVS compensation, focusing on whether abuse occurring in Florida qualifies under a New York indictment.

events.title: Email Forwarding OVS Application
events.description: Forwarded email from Brittany Henderson to other attorneys attaching an OVS application for a victim and mentioning treatment plans.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing legal discussions in April 2020 about victim compensation through the Office for Victims of Services (OVS) related to Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.
It highlights a jurisdictional issue: attorneys debate whether a victim abused in Florida can qualify for OVS under a New York indictment because the crime must be 'physical on NY state soil.'
The victim in question was part of a New York indictment and received calls from New York to participate in massages in Florida.
Brittany Henderson, a trial attorney, is actively handling an OVS application for a victim and coordinating with Brad Edwards.
If approved, the victim plans to receive treatment from Randee Kogan, indicating post-trauma care considerations for Epstein's victims.
